title: Measure chlorophyll-a and pheophytin-a by Turner Designs

protocol.title: Measure chlorophyll-a and pheophytin-a by Turner Designs
protocol.title_html: Measure chlorophyll-a and pheophytin-a by Turner Designs

source.description: Primary stock: ≅10 mg/L
Saturated magnesium carbonate solution
Extract samples on the filter
Allow Turner to warm-up for at least 15 minutes.
90% buffered acetone
Acetone/DMSO extraction solvent
0.1 N HCl

source.title: Measure chlorophyll-a and pheophytin-a of samples

source.description:
Use extraction of blank filter to zero the instrument on the sensitivity setting that will be used for sample analysis.
Or simply log the reading of blank filter extraction and subtract the reading from reading of sample extraction.
Chlorophyll-a (ug/L)=r*(Rb-Ra)*DF/(r-1)
Add 10 grams magnesium carbonate to 1000 mL of MilliQ water.
Settle the solution for a minimum of 24 hours.
100 mL clear “powder free” magnesium carbonate solution
900 mL HPLC grade acetone
Mix in an amber reagent bottle.
Mix three parts 90% acetone and two parts of HPLC grade DMSO (Shoaf and Lium 1975)

Dissolve one part of
HCl in 119 parts of MilliQ water
Dissolve 1 mg Chlorophyll-a in a 100 mL glass volumetic flask by 90% acetone, top to 100 mL.
Aliquote 5 mL to Amber vial with glass serological pipet (5 mL)

Store at
to

source.body: Flashpoint of acetone is

source.description: Second calibration standard: (≅400 ug/L)
Warm up primary stock to room temperature and transfer 4 mL primary stock to a 100 mL glass volumetric flask

source.body: Adjust the volume of primary stock according to the actual concentration of second calibration standard

source.description: Top with 90% acetone to 100 mL
Working calibration standard (≅16 ug/L)

source.body: Maximum concentration of detection range is 15~20 ug/L

source.description: Fill cuvette and place it in udrop plate, measure absorbance at 664 nm
Chlorophyll-a_mg/L = 11.42 X Absorbance at 664 nm, where 11.42 is the extinction coefficient of chlorophyll-a at 664 nm.

source.body: Detection limit of spectrophotometrical measurement is about 350 ug/L

source.description: Label Amber vials with the actual concentration of chlorophyll-a stock solution

Aliquote 5 mL to amber vials, label cryobox with actual concentration and store at
to
.
Warm up second calibration standard and transfer 2 mL solution to a 50 mL glass volumetric flask

source.body: Adjust the volume of second calibration standard according to the actual concentration of second calibration standard

source.description: Top with 90% acetone to 50 mL
Label 20 mL scintillation vials and place them in scintillation vial rack.
Add 5 mL Acetone/DMSO extraction solvent
Cap the vial, and vortex.
Transfer sample and blank filter into scintillation vial
Cover the scintillation vials with another scintillation rack.

Let samples be extracted for
at
Vortex samples and allow samples to be extracted for another
Extract liquid samples
Measure absorbance at 664 nm.
Chlorophyll-a_mg/L = 11.42 X Absorbance at 664 nm, where 11.42 is the extinction coefficient of chlorophyll-a at 664 nm.

source.body: Detection limit of spectrophotometrical measurement is about 350 ug/L

source.description: Freeze liquid sample and blank
Add extraction solvent into frozen sample
Cap the vial, vortex and place sample in the dark at room temperature for
Vortex and place sample in the dark for another
Standards
Place the solid secondary standard in Turner, wait 15 seconds for the reading to stabilize.
Record the reading on the solid standard calibration record sheet.

Reading should be less than 10% of the previously determined post calibration value.
Otherwise, calibrate Turner by liquid standard before measuring samples (Go to the last step: Calibrate Turner)
Primary Chlorophyll a standards
Come as a set of one low (15 ~ 20 ug/L) and one high (140 ~ 160 ug/L) concentration in foil wrapped ampules. Use low concentration for the calibration only.

source.body: Actual concentration varies by LOT, and is listed on a certificate

source.description: Break the ampule with breaker and pour directly into the test tube
Blank: 90% buffered acetone
Press to reach Main Menu screen.
Press <2> to reach the Calibration Menu screen. Set the concentration range control to AUTO.
From screen 2.0, press <4> to bring up screen 2.4, then <3> to bring up screen 2.43 (set conc. range control), and press to toggle.
Press to screen 2.0, press <2> to access screen 2.2 (standard solution concentration). Enter the actual concentration of the primary liquid calibration standard (e.g. the value from the certificate).
Press to return to screen 2.0.
Press <1> to access screen 2.1 and confirm that option #2 on screen 2.1 reads YES.
Press to return to HOME screen.
While on the HOME screen, fill a clean 13-mm culture tube with 90% acetone (the blank). Put the tube in the sample chamber and replace the light cap.

source.body: Because temperature affects fluorescence, do not allow the blank to remain in the instrument any longer than necessary for a stable reading.

source.description: Press , <2>, <1>, and <1> to access 2.11 After the Blank % reading is stable (“TC” on screen 2.11 cycles from 1 to 8 seconds) and assuming the Blank % is less than 200%, press <0>.
When “FINISHED” appears, press all the way to HOME.
Remove the blank. Set tube aside.
While on the HOME screen, place the tube with the LOW primary chlorophyll a standard in the sample chamber and replace the light cap.

source.body: Because temperature affects fluorescence, do not allow the blank to remain in the instrument any longer than necessary for a stable reading.

source.description: Pressing , <2>, and <3> to access 2.3
Using UP and DOWN arrows to adjust Span% until the FS reading is the closest to actual value of primary standard.
Wait until reading is stable (“TC” on screen cycles from 1 to 8 sec.), then press <*>.
When “FINISHED” appears, press all the way to HOME screen.
Read the primary liquid standard on the home screen by pressing <*>, to confirm that the calibration was properly set and record the calibrant and reading on the calibration log sheet.
Place the solid secondary standard in the instrument, read the LOW value. Record the reading on the solid standard calibration record sheet as the reference of daily check.

source.title: Measure chlorophyll-a and pheophytin-a of standard

source.description: Use PP pipet tip to transfer 5 mL 90% acetone to disposable glass tube, wipe the outside of the tube dry with kimwipe and place in the instrument. Replace the light cap.

source.title: Measure chlorophyll-a and pheophytin-a of standard

source.description: Wait about 15 seconds for the reading to stabilize, and zero the instrument on the sensitivity setting.

source.title: Measure chlorophyll-a and pheophytin-a of standard

source.description:
Transfer 5 mL working calibration standard (prepared in
) to a disposable glass tube, measure the fluorescence. Log the reading as "standard before acidification (Rb)".

source.title: Measure chlorophyll-a and pheophytin-a of standard

source.description: Add 150 ul 0.1N HCl to working calibration standard.

source.title: Measure chlorophyll-a and pheophytin-a of standard

source.description: Carefully mix solution by vortexing for 10 seconds and measure the fluorescence again. Log the reading as "standard after acidification (Ra)".

source.title: Measure chlorophyll-a and pheophytin-a of standard

source.description:
Calculate the ratio, r, as follows:
r=Rb/Ra

source.title: Measure chlorophyll-a and pheophytin-a of samples

source.description: Transfer sample extract to disposable glass tube.

source.title: Measure chlorophyll-a and pheophytin-a of samples

source.description: If the display reads OVER, dilute the sample and reread. Log dilution factor (DF) and reading (Rb).

source.body: Always bring total volume of diluted to 5 mL, so that the volume of 0.1 N HCl doesn't need to be changed.

source.title: Measure chlorophyll-a and pheophytin-a of samples

source.description: Add 150 ul 0.1N HCl. Carefully mix solution by vortexing for 10 seconds and measure the fluorescence again. Log the reading (Ra).
pheophytin-a (ug/L)=r*(rRa-Rb)*DF/(r-1)

description: Here we describe a protocol for measuring chlorophyll-a and pheophytin-a from microalgae by using Turner Designs (10-AU)
